title: 111_s3849
content: The Act may be cited as the "Job Preservation for Parents in Poverty Act" and includes an extension and modification of the TANF Emergency Fund. The "Job Preservation for Parents in Poverty Act" includes an extension and modification of the TANF Emergency Fund, with amendments to Section 403(c) of the Social Security Act. This includes the availability and use of funds for fiscal years 2009 and 2010, with specific allocations for the first quarter of fiscal year 2011. The TANF Emergency Fund under the "Job Preservation for Parents in Poverty Act" allows funds to remain available through fiscal year 2011 for grants to States based on expenditures in the first quarter of fiscal year 2011. The TANF Emergency Fund allows funds to remain available through fiscal year 2011 for grants to States based on expenditures in the first quarter of fiscal year 2011. $500,000 shall be reserved for use in fiscal year 2012 for grants for expenditures incurred by States after December 31, 2010. The TANF Emergency Fund allows funds to remain available through fiscal year 2011 for grants to States based on expenditures in the first quarter of fiscal year 2011. $500,000 shall be reserved for use in fiscal year 2012 for grants for expenditures incurred by States after December 31, 2010. In paragraph (3), adjustments are made for fiscal years 2009, 2010, and 2011. The TANF Emergency Fund allows funds to remain available through fiscal year 2011 for grants to States based on expenditures in the first quarter of fiscal year 2011. An expenditure for subsidized employment shall be taken into account only if used to subsidize employment for a member of a needy family. The TANF Emergency Fund provides grants to States for expenditures related to subsidized employment for needy families or individuals who have exhausted unemployment compensation rights. The total amount of payments is limited with adjustment authority for fiscal years 2009 and 2010. The TANF Emergency Fund provides grants to States for subsidized employment for needy families. The total payments are limited for fiscal years 2009 and 2010, with adjustment authority available if the fund is at risk of depletion. The Secretary may specify priority criteria for awarding grants to States and adjust percentage limitations for the first quarter of fiscal year 2011 under the TANF Emergency Fund. Additionally, expenditures described in paragraph (3)(C)(iv) are included in the grant provisions. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 is amended to change dates from October 1, 2010, to January 1, 2011. Grant requirements under the Social Security Act are modified effective October 1, 2010. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 is amended to change dates from October 1, 2010, to January 1, 2011. Grant requirements under the Social Security Act are modified related to increased expenditures. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 is amended to change dates to January 1, 2011. Section 407(b)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to adjust grant requirements. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will issue program guidance to ensure that funds for subsidized employment do not support positions with salaries exceeding a certain amount, as defined by the State. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will provide guidance to prevent subsidized employment funds from supporting positions with salaries exceeding 200 percent of the poverty line for a family of 4 or the median wage in the jurisdiction. The Contingency Fund for State Welfare Programs under the Social Security Act will receive $112,000,000 for fiscal year 2012 and $612,000,000 for fiscal year 2013.
